definition: to pursue unremittingly (idiom); to persevere
to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
permanent/constant/fixed/usual/ordinary/rule (old)/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷟)
surname Heng

sentences.english: "I attended real life classes, but soon found it difficult to continue, " said Shi.
sentences.chinese: 我曾修過現實的課程，但很快我便發現很難持之以恆。

sentences.english: A regular bedtime and rising time can help you stablize your internal clocks.
sentences.chinese: 定一個規律的作息時間，持之以恆。

sentences.english: As long as assiduous and cultivated, perserve, final and regular meeting has good get one's own back.
sentences.chinese: 只要勤奮耕耘，持之以恆，最終一定會有好的回報。

sentences.english: A consistent, medium-intensity routine is a proven cold-stopper.
sentences.chinese: 持之以恆的中等強度的常規運動已被證明能防止感冒。

sentences.english: Four must explore and form the public education mechanism which a set perseveres.
sentences.chinese: 四要探索並形成一套持之以恆的宣傳教育機制。

sentences.english: In the study, she also can perserve, continuous progress.
sentences.chinese: 在學習上，她也能持之以恆，不斷進步。

sentences.english: Be in encouraging consumer to perserve the ground participates in new media to consume, go.
sentences.chinese: 二是鼓勵消費者持之以恆地參與到新媒體消費中去。

sentences.english: As we will persevere in front of thorns.
sentences.chinese: 任前方荊棘叢生我們將持之以恆。

sentences.english: Consistency and authenticity will be key in leading tomorrow’s workforce.
sentences.chinese: 持之以恆和真誠將成爲領導未來勞動力的關鍵所在。

sentences.english: Consistency and authenticity will be key in leading tomorrow's workforce.
sentences.chinese: 持之以恆和真誠將成爲領導未來勞動力的關鍵所在。

sentences.english: But as with anything, persistence and practice is rewarded.
sentences.chinese: 但是，對於任何事情，持之以恆和練習都是必須的。

sentences.english: The dream was not easy to realized but insistance helps him wins.
sentences.chinese: 夢想是不容易實現，但持之以恆幫助他贏了。

sentences.english: Persevere, so can the stones penetrated.
sentences.chinese: 持之以恆，所以才能把石塊打穿。

sentences.english: The secret of success iin constancy of purpose.
sentences.chinese: 成功之祕訣乃持之以恆。

sentences.english: Create a sleeping schedule and stick to it.
sentences.chinese: 制定一個睡眠計劃表，並持之以恆地堅持下去。

sentences.english: If you like how you feel after three weeks you can stick with it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在三週後感覺不錯，就可以持之以恆。

definition: to toughen/to temper/to engage in physical exercise/to work out/(fig.) to develop one's skills/to train oneself
secret know-how/key (to longevity)/secret (of happiness)/recipe (for success)
to have one's feet firmly planted on the ground (idiom); realistic without flights of fancy/steady and serious character
to persevere unremittingly (idiom); to keep going until the end
physical capability/stamina
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to train hard/to practice diligently/hard work/blood, sweat, and tears
hardworking/diligent
to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk
to make a firm resolution
in sequence, step by step (idiom); to make steady progress incrementally
format/form
to cultivate/to raise/to form (a habit)/to acquire
to accumulate over a long period of time
to practice what one preaches (idiom)
to temper oneself/to steel oneself/self-discipline/endurance
